reviews.text: Bit overpriced tickets and the pick and mix to. Tho in all fairness the cinema was absolutely clean and the seats were amazingly comfy! 6.95-7.95 max would be a better price to go for.. Or even a certain day where all films are 5. Between certain times.. Quantity would help as cinemas are a dying to do on most peoples lists

Stepping foot outside this place makes you feel like you've taken a time machine back 35 years, and I mean that in the best way possible.
The old style letter board outside, the external decor with its red neon, everything makes this place feel like a time capsule.
The lobby is somewhat more modern, and a central desk surrounded by walkways is an interesting touch.
The screens themselves aren't anything to write home about, but I had no problems enjoying my movie.
The staff are relaxed and friendly.
Had an excellent time and got to pretend I was a character in stranger things for a bit as I walked out. What more could you want?

Tickets and snacks good prices. Got through really quick. Seats are REALLY uncomfortable and small. No drinks holders. Everything has to sit on the floor, which explains why it's so sticky.

Good open reception with lovely staff... Cinema screens are big, but everyone squashed like sardines in tiny seats.

I haven’t been to this one yet I am going tonight to see Captain Marvel and by the looks of it. It looks alright. The seats are a bit low down unlike the odeon in Liverpool One. No cup holders!!! Which would be nice. If the seats are low down can you see the screen because of people in front of you?

It's a really good cinema with a great choice of movies.. but (and it's a big but), the cost of going the movies now, for what you're actually getting with this place, is a bit steep. £24 for tickets (3D glasses included but not extra legroom), to sit on a seat that's clearly been there since it opened, is a bit of a swizz.

The bonus is that the cinema is covered in "new seats coming" posters, so they'll hopefully catch up to the newer cinemas soon.

Cost of drinks/popcorn was also a bit high, £18 for a drink and a bag of popcorn is a bit steep again. Whilst I appreciate that these places make money on their "extras", I would rather it was a little lower.

Overall a nice cinema, waiting for the upgrade to re-review the place. I may however look elsewhere in the future just to get a feel for what else is available.

The Dock is the main attraction in Liverpool. This place is surrounded by many museums including the TITANIC museum. Yes, TITANIC was here on the initial days. There are many nice monumental buildings for good photographs. After seeing all the museums, take a walk in the near the sea area, you will feel loved.. Yes there is a love locks street near the Dock. Tie a love lock 🔒 with your loved ones and celebrate the occasion with a cool breeze of air

If you come in Liverpool is of course a place to visit, is really suggestive and beautiful you can see how particular could be this city, is my first time here and I love it from the begin. Is absolutely one of the most beautiful thing to see in Liverpool. I'm really enjoyed to walk in through! Very recommended

Great place to visit either as a tourist or a local. Loads to do & see at the Albert Dock. Plenty of places to stop for something to eat as well. Easy to get to & find your way around. Is home to many iconic shots of the city skyline & attractions of the city. Always worth a trip whenever you are in Liverpool

This is a fabulous place. Clean, interesting, SO many things to do and see. Restaurants galore. It was very cold and windy on one of the days that we were there, so dress appropriately. Its a very lively hub and one of the best waterfront areas we have ever been to. Plenty of photo opportunities, lots of history and art. You can spend the whole day here and then come back again the next day for more.
Great place. full of history. Love walking round. Plenty of places to grab a bite to eat. All the times I have been there the food has been enjoyable.

Great place to visit with the family. A couple of minutes walk from Liverpool Lime Street station. Lots to see inside, mummies, dinosaurs, natural history .. you name it. There is always something new being added too. The fact that it's free means it's open to everyone. Great stuff ..
Had a great time at the museum, will certainly come again because we didn't get to see it all. The Planetarium show we watched was also really good. The mummy display was the best I have ever seen.

Please visit this place for sure if you are in Liverpool.

You'll find very good things and you'll get good knowledge of the better part of the world. 

The culture that used to exist in the world is presented in a great display with every small detail.

Planetarium display is expected to be awesome, don't forget to visit this attraction.

Enjoy.

The visiting exhibitions are often superb, and the permanent collection includes some wonderful things as well as some fun stuff for children (the aquarium is always a hit).

The thing to watch out for is the lifts, which aren't quite up to the job on busy weekends and half terms. There's another one somewhere in the back which can save you a long queue if the main two are rammed.

Pleasant cafe at the bottom.

What a gem of a place, went to see terracotta army and spent an unexpected day enjoying the rest of this museum. It is clearly dated but if you spend the time to explore it proved to be very interesting, especially the rooms with the pull out draws. Staff helpful and polite. If you have a genuine interest to learn then this is for you. Fantastic wheelchair access too.

What a stunning place to visit. So much to see and so well presented. Unbelievable that is free entry with hours of exhibits to look over.

Went to see the Leonardo De Vincci exhibition (500 years) so we'll worth the visit but there is so much more to see. It's a must for another look round as I don't believe you can do it all in one visit.

Exceptional value. 😊 😊 😊

Love this place as is beautiful. Architecture is breathtaking  and well worth just taking a look around on that basis.

Gallery is OK but a lot of copies of original famous paintings, but to clarify these are reproductions from the original historical era.

Cafe is good too with a wide selection of refreshments.

Lovely building. Will go back to look at more galleries. We're there for the Charles Rennie Macintosh exhibition.  Was well priced. Fantastic display.  Learned a lot about the Glasgow artists. The displays of furniture were well done. Spent two hours in the exhibit.

Magnificent art works. Just been to see the Leonardo sketches and so impressed I can't wait to go to Manchester, Leeds and Sheffield to see the sketches on show there.
After viewing the Leonardo's went for a walk around the rest of the gallery. Haven't been for a few years and it like seeing old friends. I'll make the effort to go to the Rennie Mackintosh exhibition that's coming soon.

We visited to catch the Charles Rennie Mackintosh exhibition, actually covering the wider Glasgow style / movement. We also viewed some of the permanent exhibition spaces & had a cuppa in one of Liverpool's best tea rooms. OK the barrista was going flat out too but I was still back in a CR Mackintosh tea room.
Possibly the most beautiful gallery in the city, it houses some fantastic art. Regular events and exhibitions make this an essential part of any visit to the city if art is on your agenda.
Small but extremely interesting and fascinating gallery / museum in a wonderfully preserved old building. Definitely worth a visit!
Good food and good service, even when very busy.
This is a hidden gem. There's always stuff going on. It is beautiful, gorgeous and clean!
University of Liverpool amazing displays a wealth of knowledge.

I didn't know anything about this place but someone took me inside to a pop up used record store. And it was impressive. 

The cafe is decent too. It's a good idea to keep an eye out for the fairs and stores that come in for a day or weekend as the quality is pretty high. 

Fantastic building too.

A hidden delight right in the centre of Liverpool.
Nice little cafe with a bigger restaurant upstairs.
Home to various artisan workshops plus an art gallery.
Disabled access good.  Friendly staff.
Nice little garden for taking a shopping break.
I like the Bluecoat. Oasis in the middle of the city and mostly vibrant. Cafe has good quality food and usually plenty of room . Staff are polite and there is always something going on.
Mixed use arts space and the oldest building in the city centre - a must see for every Liverpudlian and guests to the city!
Great food and interesting setting within an urban arts centre. Soup and sandwiches was very tasty and wholesome
This is the most beautiful and atmospheric cathedral. It is so peaceful, you feel that you are welcome. I go to the cathedral most days just to sit and take some quiet time for myself
Well situated. We walked to visit both cathedrals. Free parking was great. Room good value for the price. Not noisy and quiet area.
Great, modern looking cathedral located between two universities. Totally worth checking it out. You don’t get that “feeling” you normally get from huge cathedrals but it is still awesome to check.

Interesting building. The largest Catholic Church in the England. Very modern, reminiscent to 60s era but a peaceful place to rest and unburden your weary soul . Donations encouraged for its daily upkeep. Security on watch.

Don't get put off by the signs warning that there is a service ongoing... They seem to be there to put you off going in even when there isn't.
Once in though, if you like modernist architecture, you won't be disappointed. Very atmospheric place of contemplation.

Such a great building and a real shame it's been left standing for so long. There's a caretaker living on site in a caravan who was nice enough to let us walk around the building and take some pictures. I hope they do something with it soon.
Truly magnificent building, and what a beautiful place to worship. Huge thanks for the amazing hospitality, and educational activities you provided for my Scouts.
Wonderful evening of music in such beautiful surroundings.

Beautiful Synagogue.
Warm colour and great architecture.
The decoration is really stunning. Booking a tour in advance is required. It is definitely worthy to visit.

I went to the bombed out church beer festival at Saint Luke's Church. There was an amazing selection of great real ale from all over the country plus a good local section. The venue within the church is fabulous. I spent some time just walking around the gardens and looking at the building. It is great see a building like this being brought back to life with events like this.

I find it amazing how great this bombed out church is preserved. From the outside you would even say it has no problem. I liked its architectural style more than that of the Liverpool Cathedral. Of course this one is not as imposing and is empty inside but still. The walls look great and it is nice to see how the sunlight plays on what is left. There is also a nice little garden around.

My second favorite. This church is undervalued since the Liverpool cathedral takes all the credit since is taller and larger. This one, is beautiful and it is worth to see it.   You can also go walking from downtown or on your way or way back from the Cathedral. This city is just awesome to walk to.

Just had an amazing Sunday there Yoga followed by Meditation inside the church.
All provided by Laura our Yoga and Meditation teacher.
Thank you Laura and XHail hope to see you again soon.

Went to the beer festival on the 11 April 19.
Reasonable well organised, friendly staff.
Beers. Not that great

Elegant home of the Holt Family, with beautiful grounds available to the public. Two Turner paintings at eye level, a lovely coffee shop, and regularly changing special exhibitions. Two rooms for children to explore and well designed activity rooms with good disabled access throughout the building. Very well informed staff. The current exhibition 'Model Image: Fashion and photos from the 1950s'  is listed as ending in 2019. The exhibition features the photographic life of international model, Jane Duncan, who was born locally. Very apt that her incredible images are close to her origins.

Great hidden gem!  Historic house plus bonus fashion exhibition upstairs. 
Playrooms fab for kids and scrumptious food in cafe - vegan catered for too😊
Interesting exhibition of local fashion model from the 50's. Photos though are part of the normal your and it's free.

What a delight this place is . Former home of the Holt family . Each room is laid out much as it was in the Victorian era and you are given a talk via a video virtual guide as if of that period , informative and light hearted. There are few staff about but all of them are friendly and can impart even more information and snippets. I would like to see more real guides in period dress acting the roles of the family and domestic staff this would transform the experience completely to another level? Good experience for drama students too? There are some great artworks on display and if like me your a Preraphaelite fan you won't be disappointed . Great way to spend a couple of hours escape into the past then finish your visit with a nice slice of cake and coffee.
I attend an art class at Sudley House every Saturday - we're called Sudley Painters. It's a beautiful setting, lovely cafe and really friendly staff.

Enjoyed this as was some frights and interesting tales. Not quite what I thought it was going to be as thought it was more of actors jumping out of street corners. The stories were interesting but I do feel this is probably better if you’ve had a few drinks in you first.

We did the Hope Street Shivers Tour.  Was great from start to finish.  The guides were hilarious, full of energy and very knowledgeable.  Would definitely recommend this tour and next time in Liverpool will be booking another tour.

Vicky and Lynn

Didn’t stop laughing from start to end, our hosts were bloody amazing! They totally made our night. 

I attended the ‘Auld City and the dead house tour’. I would definitely recommend this!!

Lasted 1.5 hours (no breaks so go the toilet beforehand haha). Would recommend wrapping up warm and wearing comfortable shoes
Not necessarily spooky, but bloody hilarious .Our 2nd attempt . Finally made it, through the storm. Was worth the wait
Excellent. We're a group of 24 year olds who throughly enjoyed this. The hosts are truly excellent. It's not hugely scary but very funny and generally entertaining, would highly recommend!!

Definitely a great place for a fan of the Beatles, as I am not one it definitely wasn’t worth the price. The whole tour was done through the headphones. However it’s a fun journey walking around and exploring the journey of the Beatles. I would say it would definitely be more exiting for a fan of them! A store at the end of the tour to buy some merchandise

It was good. We spent the best part of the afternoon going around the museum with a guided head phone set. We learnt a great deal. The only negative was the entrance price which was quite high at £45 for a family of four.

This is a must for Beatles fans, or just anyone with a pulse! The superb audio guide takes you through the entire experience, superbly supported by artefacts, memorabilia and information. The excerpts of music throughout is a nice added bonus too. No element of Beatles history was missed, or glossed over and I can't recommend The Beatles Story highly enough.

I went there 2 or 3 years ago and It was amazing loved every minute of it the part were we saw John Lennon's piano and the lyrics on the wall was very moving and emotional. I loved the yellow submarine part as well because it's my favourite song from the Beatles definitely worth the money the history from the earphones was great the staff were very good too a must see in liverpool and the gift shop was so good too x

This was a bit disappointing for me, all done on ear phones. Very factual etc but maybe it's just for someone who doesn't know much about the Beatles. Staff were friendly and pleasant. 
This is only my opinion, another person I know loved it. So it very much depends on you.

A good little coffee shop, just off Bold Street. Seating can be limited at the busy times of day but it's definitely worth the wait. The food is reasonably priced, delicious and plentiful. The coffee is great and the range of freshly made baked goods is good too.
Wonderfully airy, peaceful and modern. Great coffee with a lovely welcome. Plenty of space to work, with well thought out power socket arrangements. Definitely recommended.
A firm favourite in Liverpool, especially for coffee. Quiet enough to sit with a book but open enough to bring your friend and chat. Great service, never disappointed here.
In the top 3 coffee places in Liverpool. With the best interior.
The food was homemade and very good but overpriced. The staff were very slow and unhelpful. They also charged different prices to what was on the menu

This was recommended from a friend.
The atmosphere was really welcoming and comforting. I wanted to sit on the sofa but decided to sit in the normal table/chairs. 
We went for breakfast and I loved the Kabdeh. We needed more bread but I still loved it. Would have ordered more if I could eat more but I got full! 

Would definitely recommend and visit next time I am in Liverpool again!

Only thing I want to tell the restaurant is to clean the menus and table a little better.

Thanks for the service though!

So they lost star for not having card payments. And they lost second star for not being prepared at all for my gluten free order. Staff should not be using words ... I think. They do not have gluten free menu but they recommended some from normal menu. We will see what will happen. Ordered kebab with rice, it tasted good but portion was small for 9 pounds. Surely room for improvements.
Always come to this place the food is sooo tasty. I wish they had more comfy seating sofas. Sometimes it can be a little cold in the winter but the food is fab
Always nice every time we go. Plenty of space to sit and eat. Carrot cake portions are huge!!

Food is good and portion size is worth the money,
Great kebab taste amazing and pizza is stupendous.

Prices are not too expensive, very nice interior and not too busy so really great for dates.

Would advise people to go

Strong 8/10

Oat cappuccino with syrup and vegan cake. Nice, vibrant, industrial cafe with a student vibe. Friend had an 'ordinary' cappuccino. Was quite cold (although I'd expect that with tall ceilings) would go again and recommend.
Good coffee, would prefer to come here than a chain code shop. Nice place to sit and watch the traffic pass.
Loveliest coffee and cakes. Friendly and helpful staff too. Chilled atmosphere. Love it!

Nice atmosphere but rather mediocre coffee. I would like espresso foam denser and darker. Coffee also was a little on the cool side. Pour over coffee was slightly weak. Very good service, staff very friendly and eager to answer questions about coffee.
A little oasis of calm ,serving very good coffee. Plenty of coffee related stuff to buy or just kick back an chill with the eclectic mix of tunes
The food is amazing but dissapointly I've been there quite a few times and I'm yet to meet Mr Miyagi.

Lovely food and attentive service. Quite a dark atmosphere, felt like getting my torch out at one point to see what I was eating! Overall, really tatsy well presented food that is great value for money.
Litreally ticks all the boxes. Good service, great food and a fantastic bevvy list, what more do you want ! . Would defiantly recommend this restaurant if you want to try a Japanese-Asian infusion
Amazing food and a great head chef!
Beautiful food but quite pricey for what you get. Nice place though
The best place for a fry. The milkshakes are pretty spectacular too. I have been going to Maggie Mays for years, and enjoy heading to one of the cafes when I visit now.

Nice food but as it doesn't allow card payments or split payment of bills it has to receive 3. This policy put me off returning as I had to go to an Atm after arriving so to enjoy food with my friends.

They made us wait outside to be seated for quite a while on a snowy and chilling weather whereas we were just 2 and there were several tables already available. Didn't even allow us to wait in the hallway for ""security reasons"" and never attended us eventually while passing in front of us... (thanks, guys...). Plus, note that you can ONLY pay by cash (no credit card accepted).

This Café doesn't support card and didn't have Soya milk when I went. BUT. For the price of the food, the taste of the food and the amount of the food it was fabulous! Also we got a huge VEGAN milkshake to share! Yes, I said a Vegan milkshake with vegan ice cream and vegan milk. Please go to this place! (but bring cash).
It's easy to see why people queue to get in. Excellent food with friendly and fast service. Great prices as well.

I'd not consider mutton my first choice of meat. But the curry mutton and rice really changed my mind about it. The chef seems to be handling his business very well and the food was on the table quiet quick. There's always something to improve on so I'll leave some room in my rating as well. Food 5/5, shop 3/5, makes a solid 4 stars. :)
Unmissable! This place is an absolute gem! I drove 12 miles for their curried mutton and I’d come back again without a doubt!
Amazing place. Good food and nice vibe
Nice food but did not get what i asked for

Been going to Raggas for years and was never let down (as you can see by my 5* review last year). However, lately it has been shocking. Not sure if it's changed hands or not? The past few times I have been the portion sizes have been terrible (not enough). We paid £20 on Friday for wings, 2 large meals and 2 dumplins. Got home to find there was far too much rice and my partner found his "large" stake to be in fact 3 tiny pieces of meat with literally no sauce. My portion size was awful too and there was no juice. Just dry jerk chicken. Called the shop and they told me they had in fact gave us small portions by mistake. Apology accepted but left out of pocket and hungry. Always been fab but lately not good. However, staff are friendly.
Had a wonderful experience at this cozy tea house. Staff are brilliant and the scones are lovely! Went with my wife and 3 year old. Will definitely visit again.

Popped in to pick up a gift that had been ordered, to find a delightful tea room with a very wide range of teas. The cakes looked so delicious I bought some to take home and they were widely appreciated - the dairy free and gluten free options were excellent. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Cosy atmosphere.
Nice comfy place.  Excellent coffee and scone.  Bought a tea pot too.
had a really tasty flatbread toastie and a gorgeous floral tea. Will definitely visit again : )
I had the vegan breakfast. It was great, a lot better than the usual vegan breakfasts of fake bacon and tofu egg. Will definitely be coming back!

Picked up some take out. I had the Mongolian Beef with steamed rice and hot & sour soup. The soup was delicious and on the spicy side. Rice was nice and fluffy and I asked for a little cup of the “red sweet/sour sauce” as I like to put it on the rice. They were happy to accommodate my request.
The Mongolian Beef was outstanding! It was still piping hot when I opened the carton at home. The meat was tender and full of flavor. Best I’ve had in town. Will definitely order from them again.

I have a very mixed opinion of this place. Im giving three stars only because the food is always great, fresh, etc which is why I keep going back. HOWEVER, the service in house is subpar. Staff always seems frustrated that you are there and it takes FOREVER to get your food. So only go if you are not in a hurry to be anywhere soon. As far as calling in, good luck. That’s hit or miss. Some days I can get an answer and other days I never am able to get anyone to pick up the phone, and yes- I am calling during their funky business hours. Also, if you call in, still expect it to take at least 30 minutes or more for your food to be ready to be picked up.
Food not to bad.
We love this place. Been following that s business for over 20 years.
Nice Thai food, and inexpensive.
Lovely food and great service. The atmosphere is great and the chefs do a fantastic job. If you are looking for an experience then definitely come here, you won't regret it.

Went with a friend on a busy Thursday night for dinner. Atmosphere was wonderful, food was fresh and delicious. Entertainment was 10/10 and fabulous. Highly recommend and looking forward to going back very soon. Thank you Sapporo

Filthy and vulgar. The floor is literally covered in oil from all the frying, it's actually difficult to walk to maintain balance. Then the cook started throwing food into people's mouths and playing tricks with it. And overall food was just average quality. Definitely not coming back and would not recommend it at all. I struggle to see why they got all these good reviews.

I go to Sapporo on a regular basis now that even one of the managers recognises me and my partner when we arrive. We love the food and the entertainment that comes with it. We tend to go to the early lunch menu as it's definitely worth the price in the day but atmosphere is quieter but we don't mind either

Amazing fun experience. Great skilled chefs and delicious fresh food cooked right in front of you. Staff are friendly and worked around allergy. Very entertaining evening. We had to book the special table to watch chefs specifically. Highly recommended.

Tried this place from a recommendation and was not disappointed. Great friendly service, nice decor and atmosphere on a Sunday afternoon.
I had the Sunday roast which had lamb that was tender and juicy. The vegetables were still crunchy and not overcooked. I did not opt for the dessert but my friend ordered the sticky toffee pudding with ice cream which he thoroughly enjoyed.
Not the biggest of portions and not the cheapest of places for a Sunday lunch  but a well cooked enjoyable meal
We were the out for dinner and fish and chips and the other dishes were just amazing. Service was very polite and the atmosphere is awesome. Thank u.

Used to be one of my fave places to go in Liverpool ... I’ve been here with various people and circles but tonight we came at 22:10 with 10 medics on a conference to be told “we aren’t serving anymore” - seriously? You’re open til 23:00 and you have served me on numerous occasions past 22:10 (for drinks which we wanted) and yet today that waiter seemed like he couldn’t be bothered. Really bad service for an otherwise epic pub :( what a shame.
Beautiful/cozy place, good food and amazing service. We made the lunch menu and for £12.50 we got an amazing lunch.

We were passing by the Monro this morning and we noticed that they have breakfast for vegetarians. 
We couldn't fault our decision to enter.
The manager was very kind so he let as pick our table next to the window.
We had a lot of options to choose from and we decided to get Two smoothie bowls and to share an avocado with cherry tomatoes and poached egg on a sourdough. 
Very impressed from the presentation.
We will definitely return to try more of this menu.

Let me just say this right out the gate: probably one of the best restaurants in Liverpool. Certainly the best Mexican food you can get in the city. 

My suggestion is to order lots and share between everyone at your table. You'll want to try as much of the food as you can your first time there. It is all excellent. 

As for the restaurant it self, it's well decorated to feel very cosy. Lots of seating nice and spread out. There also appears to be a area for hire by parties downstairs, not that I participated, but I found one ongoing on the way to the loo. 

It's a bit of a walk from the main shopping centre or bars, but we'll worth it. I would give more stars if I could. Truly well executed, authentic Mexican, casual dining.

All tacos had similar flavour. They were certainly not bad but not great either. I've had better Mexican food in Liverpool elsewhere. The service was mediocre, probably because the place is understaffed. They brought me the wrong soft drink, didn't bother asking for the correct one though. We were a group of 6 and had to wait more than normal to be seated, although the place was half empty at that moment.

Waitress was lovely, but rushed off her feet and wasn’t enough staff for service to be good enough. Had to ask multiple times for things and felt waiters/waitresses were too busy to listen to what we were asking for.

Food was brilliant and really good value, but we did witness the barman literally sucking on the straws in the straw stand on the bar... once we complained, they didn’t nothing about it... how bizarre. Wouldn’t revisit.

Not tasty at all. All of my tacos had almost the same taste. The toilets were smelling hideously. We never understood why we were charged for service. It was not mentioned anywhere on the menu. Very disappointing!

This place used to be very good. Went in at the weekend. Waitress grumpy (admittingly, she could have had an annoying customer/boss), food was bland (and this was a place that was never afraid to put a decent amount of chili in their food), and the place looked very shabby (the skirting boards are filthy and I overheard the lady on the next table say that the toilets were in a shocking state and looked as though no one had checked them in days!)
I won't be rushing back.

Was able to get a quick bite to eat before going to the Arena for a concert. Although it was really busy, we were shown to a table. We both had Singapore Noodles, one Vegetarian and one with Chicken which were both delicious. It was reasonably priced and we felt we had had good value for money. We would go there again, as it's in Liverpool One, it's in the middle of everything.
The staff are all really friendly. Food was delicious and served rather quickly. Would definitely visit again.
Good food & great variety. 2-4-1 cocktails too albeit reduced options. I will deffo go back when next in Liverpool

A broad menu to accommodate most tastes... with a couple of "Man v Food" style challenges for those so inclined.

A word of warning... the (standard) Mixed Grill is less than half the Grill Challenge - and that was more than enough for me!

Been here before and it's always hit an miss with staff. Some staff are lovely and explain menu some staff more abrasive and just want you order and go. Staff meaning management just like they don't care. Not much vegan options and asked for vegetable Thai green curry which they put tofu in when I didn't ask for it as don't like it. Cocktails are a winner!!!

Food very nice, I think this is the best wagamama branch in Birmingham right next to the bullring. Food is generous with ample portions at this branch, staff even gave us complimentary side as the chef's had made an extra accidentally, which was a nice treat, better than throwing it away. Staff are all happy, enthusiastic and respectful to customers. Food arrives quickly and on time. Highly recommend visiting this branch.

Amazing fusion food. All healthy stuff. Would prefer a seat with a back for this price band of restaurant though. There are proper seats three but three place was full.  Will certainly be going back despite this.

A tasty restaurant where you can enjoy Asian and Japanese inspired dishes to warm you any time of day. The staff are always friendly and welcoming and help make the experience even better. There are other Wagamama's in Birmingham but the Bullring unit is by far the best quality in terms of the location and friendliness of the staff.

Great place, amazing food. Helpful and friendly staff. 
Service is pretty quick too.
Reasonable prices. Win, win win.

This was my first time visiting Wagamama and I must say that I was very impressed.  The service was top notch and the food was very tasty and well presented.  I would definitely eat there again no problem.

Expensive unless you can eat your own body weight!  Lovely food.  Wide range of dishes.  Small desserts........just the right size after what we ate!  Staff pleasant and polite even on a busy Thursday evening.  I'd go again........take Tupperware!

Love this place, loads of range of meals, all you can eat and also all you can drink on soft drinks. Seems a little pricey when you arrive, but you can soon get good value for that money you’ve spent. I particularly like the grill which will cook your choice of meat in front of you and to your liking! Well worth a visit!
Really nice place that I last went to 3/4 years ago. Much improved. Food was really tasty and very much improved from the last time. Will be going again.

Been here before as Cosmos and JRC. Nowadays it's lovely inside, clean and calm. However, don't be fooled. The floors are sparkling on the customer side but have a look behind the counters at the drains filled with rubbish, spills and food waste on the floor and generally poor hygiene. Food wise, I've found this place okay previously but our most recent visit was disgusting and we will not be returning. The sweet and sour chicken tasted like Birds Eye Cod from the frozen section of Tesco. I love seafood, but chicken should not taste like fish! Food temps were varied, at best it was warm. We started fresh 3 different times and failed to find anything edible. The thought of the poor hygiene we had seen lingering in our minds really didn't help! Oh yes  and the cherry on top was the guy who served us took the drinks vouchers from us, we were never given glasses and then when we asked for them they were reluctant to give them to us without an argument. Disappointed would be polite!

Went there this afternoon. Shocking, food warm not alot of choice what was there was bland and tasted of fish, so it was cooked in the same place as fish and I did not have any fish not that there was any fish dishes. My brother recommend it said there was a good choice Italian food pasta meat balls etc, there was none of that. Pizza looked as if it had seen better days. I have always tipped, but in this case I did not. It was terrible, will not be going back!!!!!
Good twist on a the usual food on offer served in the format. I would say better value than the other outlet. Even offers a limited range of beers. This was a great stop off on a pub crawl.
Lovely food. Loads of staff serving, not so many getting tables clean. Can't fault the food though

Waited ages to get drinks as the soda machine needed refilling so ended up getting refund for drinks as 15 minutes after getting food, had finished eating and still no drink available. Usually really good service though and food is lovely
A bit pricey for what it is but you get some tasty options.
Really enjoyed our spicy falafel bagel with roast red pepper, and sweet potato fries. Very tasty

I have to say I went to Café Rouge for a work Christmas meal, thought the choice was a little odd as I've only ever had coffee from here before, and I was very surprised with how good the food was. I would definitely recommend and go back here, the staff that served us were friendly, and drink orders were sorted very quickly. The only negative was when it came to paying the system seemed to be slow, but I suppose that's fine with splitting a bill 30 ways 😬

Lovely restaurant in a unique settings, synonymous to a French café. Great range of food including vegan, child friendly and gluten free. Staff are amazing and will go out of their way to help. All meals in group were delicious.

Great service from the team at Cheshire oaks. A special thank you to Heather and the team for making our triplets 1st birthday xtra special. Afternoon Tea was superb and Ice cream was a nice surprise for the babies 👶👶👶
Always one of my favourite eateries and there's plenty to choose from depending on your appetite. Yesterday I just had the camembert starter with fries, delightful and just enough.

What a lovely buzzing place! Went for lunch it was really busy but the service was great. We were served by Heather, who was attentive and looked after us perfectly. The food was delicious also so couldn't ask for anything more. BRILLIANT!
Loved it..fantastic food, really tasty. The staff were great very friendly, helpful. Great team work. Can't fault the place in any way.

The place is resting on its laurels now. Poorly washed water glasses were just the first sign as we sat down. Long waits although lunch rush was over. Bavette overcooked (didn't even ask how I wanted it). Indifferent service but polite. Decent Port & Tonic though which was a first for me.

We went here for what we thought would have been something special. We ordered sirloin steak which came with a few thin cooked chips and 3 mushrooms. The plate looked bare!!! A few beer battered onion rings and peas would have at least made the plate look nicer, not even any garnish!! If it wasn't for the bread starter I would have still been hungry, and all for £55. Will not be going again.
Great service, the food was delicious. Calorie information was provided in the menu. Other nutritional information would also be useful but overall, I had a great meal.

Food was okay, our server was excellent. The food is a little over priced and what you get can be a little hit and miss. The pizzas are nothing special, I've had better and cheaper elsewhere but the carbonara was excellent, not swimming cream but more of the cheesy type. 

Service was quick, and the gentleman who waited our table was efficient and pleasant.

Lunch at Brown's was a great pleasure. Cocktails were delicious, the menu offered a practical and well considered choice and the service was just right. Although the location is excellent for shopping, we chose to focus on enjoying the restaurant.

Nice bar. Can get busy, but not too difficult to get a table, even on a Saturday evening. Prices are reasonable, and service is  friendly and quick. Rustic and fashionable interior / seating area. We'll situated around several bars and restaurants. Close to the docks, too.

Good food, reasonably priced, nice staff.  Had the breakfast, which was lovely, it could have done with more pudding and the option to buy a side of chips would have been great but over all the food was of great quality and the venue was clean and well kept. Background music playlist was jazz covers of modern pop songs (very cool)

I also left a sum of money behind me and i returned an hour later, staff had put it away in the safe for me. Thanks guys
Lovely lunch. Excellent service and a really nice atmosphere. Highly recommended

Liverpool one:,Ethan our waiter was brilliant. Christmas day and he was really friendly and helpful. Thanks for the excellent service  Ethan. Food was lovely and  would definitely recommend browns. Thanks for finding my jumper and getting it to me.
Great food. Great service would recommend.
Walked to this restaurant that has a brief note on the door explaining that they're not open. They're only available for private pre booked parties.
Went to a private party on a Saturday evening. Very nice food and Bitburger lager. Good service and good atmosphere.

Lovely lunch here with my sisters yesterday. Between us we ordered the Lentil, ham and tomato soup, Hot Roast Beef Baguette, Belly Pork with Mashed Potatoes and Broccoli and a vegan Sweet Potato, Butternut Squash and Coconut Curry. All thoroughly enjoyed. They have some vegan items on the menu here, which was a surprise and delicious. Great service and very friendly.
Great menu, food and service

Great place for group, dates, solo hangout. The food was great. The drinks was great. Great selection of drinks. Prices can range from Rm10-300. Take your pic. Very enjoyable place. The band tonight was awesome! The singers was lit! Very recommend to go for a night out.

Took a while until I got a menu, staff was walking past me a lot and looking at me but not doing anything, made me feel a bit weird coming there alone. Once I was able to order it was all good. The pizza was awesome!
What can i say except this place is perfect & the service is excellent. Came here countless of times. Now let's talk about the food...yes the food...they are superb!!! 😊 worth every cent
nothing much, just good vibes good songs and etc ....

5 stars for the food, 0 star for the service. The food was extremely good and the ambience is just perfect for any occasion. We came here for my mum’s birthday celebration. However, your stuffs’ attitude was terribly bad, one of the stuffs showed unwillingness and impatience when we asked her to take photos for us. That spoiled the whole dining experience tonight. As a restaurant with reputations, you should have trained your stuffs better. We customers pay for the food as well as the service that you provide, if your stuff is unwilling to serve the customers with an open heart, then she should stay out from the service line. What’s worser than horrible food? Horrible service. I would love to come back again for the food, but you don’t deserve a second chance if your stuff’s attitude remains the same.

Still the best Pub in Liverpool. A proper old world public house, good beer, wines and selection of spirits. Great feel to the place. Also do food which is very tasty and reasonably priced. £9.95 for a large bowl of scouse served with crusty bread.

A decent, traditional pub right in the heart of Dale Street. It offers a good range of real ales and craft beers plus decent pub food at £10 for main courses. Usually packed with a mixed crowd of middle aged people. Nice town centre courtyard to sit out in during the summer.
Friendly,helpful and knowledgeable staff. Small food choice but seemed to cover most options. Good ale and gin options.
Brilliant pub with an incredible selection of ales. Decent food and a seating area to boot! A definite recommendation.

Good old style pub with a fresh twist. Good range of beers and other alcoholic beverages. Decent food at a fairly reasonable price but be aware that food is not served throughout the night and food services normally stop around 7.00 pm on weekdays.

I don't usually leave reviews, however Delifonseca Dockside was a really pleasant surprise! My girlfriend and I went for breakfast. We turned up without a booking and were seated straight away by a really friendly member of staff who took our drinks order as we sat down. We ordered breakfast and it arrived pretty quickly considering they were quite busy. The quality of the food was great (not very expensive either) and everything was well cooked. Will definitely be going back soon!
A nicely stocked delicatessen with extensive butcher produce, fine treats and traditional deli items. Nice restaurant/eatery on the premises and plenty of parking

Wonderful food and ambience. Service was excellent and personable by the lovely Mandy. The owners even provided fizz on arrival as a congratulations for our anniversary. The deli shop is a delight with a treasure trove of delectable delicacies. Viva Fonseca!
Excellent service, good staff and a delicious veggie breakfast. The mushrooms were great! X

An interesting selection of food and drink from across Europe.  We bought a selection of ice creams and a large block of Compte cheese. We would have spent more time shopping but needed to get home before the ice cream melted. They have a restaurant area which we'd like to try.

This place just gets better. The food is excellent - I've had several breakfasts, and the tapas are good value. The place is bigger than you think - there are 3 distinct rooms - but there is always a wait for tables. I always enjoy a visit here.

Had a very lovely English breakfast there. It kept me going as I had planned to walk all day. It was the perfect start to a perfect day. Staff was friendly and prompt. I would recommend you come early to avoid disappointment though, as it gets very busy with the locals.

My first visit recently for breakfast, what a gem. Although it was very busy, the staff and service were very good. The food was just wow, beyond expectations. I had the dinner brunch, pancakes, bacon and egg, all cooked to perfection. Fabulous place, I'll be back.
Amazing food, great staff. Great gluten free and vegan selection. We just keep going back again and again!
Warm welcome from staff had a great coffee. Place was busy yet had plenty of room. Nice and clean looked very fresh.

I’ve been going to Keith’s for years now. Lark Lane would not be the same without it. It’s got a really chilled out atmosphere. Great for afternoon coffee and cake catch ups or evening drinks. The food is great, the menu hasn’t changed in ages i don’t think the chalk on the boards have either. I like the large glass windows at the front. Its dog friendly. No beers on tap, lots of wine choices. Rustic feel. Relaxed. Parking is on street. Friendly staff. Recently refurbished toilets.
I've been coming here since the early 80s plenty of chairs and tables inside. It used to be a sandwich and soup kind of place. Bit more up tempo these days. Very popular place on Lark Lane....

Keith's is as old as lark lane itself and was once the most relaxed and enjoyable place on the lane.  It encapsulated what lark lane was all about.   However, it's not the bar of old.   A change in clientele and or staff lacking the ability to deal with disruptive customers has meant the relaxed atmosphere has been somewhat lost, and what made keiths 'keiths' is on a severe decline.  The food certainly isn't a patch on what once came out of the kitchen.  All good things come to end and that I'm afraid maybe the case for Keiths.
Love this place, been coming here for years. Great atmosphere, lovely staff, consistently good food and wine and they have wifi :)
Always good value but now on Saturday afternoons its become a day nursery, full of active toddlers whose parents are enjoying a drink and ignoring them completely. ITS A BAR!!! NOT A PLAY AREA!!

The best Italian restaurant in Liverpool. Food is gorgeous, drinks are lovely (nice cocktails) - went Valentines week and was still quiet. Staff were attentive and fast and made the experience even better.

Beautiful modern Italian restaurant, great for families, and there were plenty of families in on St Patrick's day. A very busy restaurant. Delicious food, very generous portions and great service. We were a party of 15 celebrating a christening and everyone was very satisfied with their meals. The only grumble is that, after most of the group had left, four of us stayed back and ordered more drinks. On checking receipts today, we were charged a 10% service charge on reach round, and there were 3 of those. The drinks are already expensive, and we had already spent A LOT of money there, so I think to be charged 10% just for serving drinks is not very nice. A lesson learnt, ALWAYS check your bill before paying folks!

Eva's 2nd Birthday meal at Et Alia was again excellent the food was hot and pleasing to the palette. 
The staff were attentive and friendly throughout our visit. 
Well worth a visit for any occasion though I would advise you book to avoid disappointment.
Tasty food and friendly staff. We had the rissoto and crab penne. The wine was also lovely. It was quite quiet but we had a great time.

Lovely food and service. Nice staff. Took my Fiancée for her birthday meal, she loved it. Thanks

But the temperature inside was freezing, I had to keep my coat on all the time I was there, not good.

They have a 15 minute, live concert every weekday at noon, where they play different types of music on the bells. Sometimes traditional music, sometimes modern music. You can hear it from all over campus!
Iconic Iowa State clock tower
Iconic Iowa State landmark
Great place to take wedding photos.

The iconic clock/bell tower that's featured in pretty much any photo collection of Iowa State University.  There's always a small musical performance at noon as well as the quarter hour chimes during normal business hours.  The recent construction of a short wall on Union Dr. (just south of the campanile) has become a really popular spot for people to take photos while visiting ISU.
